author.bio:
Save the arrow for when the olive branch fails. You might be surprised at the allys you make.
----------------------------------------------------
If people cannot be trusted with liberty, they cannot be trusted with authority.
author.bio_html:
Save the arrow for when the olive branch fails. You might be surprised at the allys you make.

If people cannot be trusted with liberty, they cannot be trusted with authority.

body:
I get what your doing. Your using the definitions where sex refers to biology and gender to cultural roles correct?

The issue I'm seeing is most people grow up equating the two to mean biological sex and don't see a reason to stop now. Even tomboys are still referred to as women because they are biologically female even if they act more masculine. I'm one of these people, but I have a reason beyond "degeneracy".

I think it would make more sense if all these different "genders" are called personalities, because that's what genders, by the definition your going by, basically are. A person isn't "boyflux" for example: they're a dude that doesn't always act stereotypically like a dude. Plus, that's redundant since most men don't act manly 100% of the time.

If the whole point is to not confine people to gender roles, then the concept of "gender" as progressives use it is in contradiction.

A transgender should be someone who acts like the opposite sex because that makes them more comfortable, a cisgender someone who identifies as their biological sex, and all these extra genders shouldn't be a thing because they try to put everyone in a box when the whole point is to let people break out of said box and be their best, truest self.

If the whole point is to not confine people to gender roles, then the concept of "gender" as progressives use it is in contradiction.

body: They want people to identify with one of two sexes because that's just how they see it. The common usage for most has always been dick = male and pussy = female, even for people who don't act like what is typical for their gender. To these people, suddenly seperating sex from gender comes off as pointless, counterintuitive, and like the ramblings of SJWs. While I have my own reasons for disagreeing with the terminology in question as I stated, this is my interpretation of the more common reason for the objection to the terminology and to gender reassignment surgery.
body_html: They want people to identify with one of two sexes because that's just how they see it. The common usage for most has always been dick = male and pussy = female, even for people who don't act like what is typical for their gender. To these people, suddenly seperating sex from gender comes off as pointless, counterintuitive, and like the ramblings of SJWs. While I have my own reasons for disagreeing with the terminology in question as I stated, this is my interpretation of the more common reason for the objection to the terminology and to gender reassignment surgery.

body:
Maybe I can break that one down too. These aren't entirely my opinions, rather the ones I've observed from others.

-To them, being transgender is little more than a mental illness and therefore transgenders should be treated as such. Why is cutting off your finger to make yourself feel better craziness, but not cutting off your dick? This along with the tendancies of transgenders to have other mental health issues, and many consider transgenders as little more than an expensive liability and a bad influence to be corrected or hidden from society.

-Distrust of mainstream media and authorities. People have been lied to so much that if the progressive/new mainstream agrees with something, it becomes suspect.

-Going back to my "bad influence" point, there's a concern that children are being mislead. They do not trust children to understand the ramifications of the decision to change genders and transition, nor do they trust parents and medical professionals to do what is best for the kid while ignoring political pressure, cultural influence, and personal greed. They're scared that kids who would otherwise be normal are gonna be influenced into becoming suicidal trannies. This is further exacerbated by LGBT stuff being pushed in children's media.

-Transgender pandering and ass kissing. They feel that transgenders are overly protected and are being allowed to do things they logically shouldn't. Such as MtF competing in women's evens despite their leftover male characteristics making it unfair, not being allowed to call them by their birth gender instead of "playing pretend", being forced to make a gay wedding cake while big tech could care less about being held accountable, people who wish to detransition being called traitors, the existance of annoying "fuck cishets" psychos, diversity hires, and more I can't think off right now.

Basically, the problem is they're scared that they can't just "live and let live" when it comes to this issue because of potential harm.

body:
>"Your trans makes me feel funny" is not an acceptable basis for legislating someone else's life.

It's more like being scared your trans is gonna do actual damage, so they want to legistlate to protect the welbeing of those around the trans. People feel "funny" about things they deem a legitimate threat. If you want them to possibly see it your way, you need to give point by point counter arguments as to why they don't need to worry. Treating them like they're obviously so stupid is just gonna make them dig their heels.

>So, letting them slide in saying male and female as terms on a form as in the meme refer to chromosomes is incorrect. Male and female doesn't refer to cell biology as I explained at length in other parts of this comment section. I won't bore you repeating it."

Again, it's so deeply ingrained to them that the meme IS the truth and that the technical terms are needless psychobabble SJW bullshit to them. It's sort of like how no one says "fag" meaning "bundle of sticks" anymore, even if it's still correct. The definition, as it's most widely understood, is now either an insult meaning "homosexual." or in some places a cigarrete.

body: There are only two genders. Even intersex is still a combination of them. Stuff like "glassgender" "stargender" and "furrygender" are not genders, they are *adjectives* as they have no relationship with sexual dimorphism. And honestly if you're that adamant about labeling all those things the simpler term for you is probably "snowflake".

Stuff like "glassgender" "stargender" and "furrygender" are not genders, they are adjectives as they have no relationship with sexual dimorphism. And honestly if you're that adamant about labeling all those things the simpler term for you is probably "snowflake".

body:
Did you just ASSUME MY GENDER???!!!!!! REEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!!!!

On a serious note, it's not nearly as much as throwing tantrums about it, making up pronouns and getting triggered when people can't keep track of them all, and constantly obsessing about your snowflake gender. Animals are not genders, and they have the same male and female genders themselves. Objects do not have genders as they aren't conscious. Concepts do not have genders. If you relate to these you relate to them separately, but they are separate from your gender.
body_html:

If you relate to these you relate to them separately, but they are separate from your gender.

body: Since you have failed to correctly guess my gender (for right now at least) if I'm trying to push it in your face I'm not doing a very good job of it. No, I haven't even brought it up at all.

body:
Yes, I'm actually male (though I question this and coming off as female to most people on sites dominated almost entirely by males is some evidence).

But more importantly, the fact that you are shocked that I'm not female based on my behavior makes me think you're one of those "oh he/she plays with girls/boys toys, they must be trans!" people. That is no less bigoted than the traditionalists. And yes, progressives can be bigots, and actually are more so on most subjects.
body_html:
Yes, I'm actually male (though I question this and coming off as female to most people on sites dominated almost entirely by males is some evidence).

But more importantly, the fact that you are shocked that I'm not female based on my behavior makes me think you're one of those "oh he/she plays with girls/boys toys, they must be trans!" people. That is no less bigoted than the traditionalists. And yes, progressives can be bigots, and actually are more so on most subjects.
